title: ‘Neighbours’ Bids Farewell To Ramsay Street In Final Episode | 10 News+
description: After 40 years, ‘Neighbours’ will air for the final time, again. The beloved soap opera was first axed in the 80s, then again in 2022, before being resurrected a second time. The revival was short-lived, so Georgie Tunny is taking a look back at the iconic Australian show for 10 News+. title: French Nationals Arrested After Stealing $10 Million Worth Of Luxury Goods | 10 News
description: $10 million worth of luxury items have been stolen during a brazen heist in our capital. title: Alleged Charlie Kirk Shooter Tyler Robinson Makes First In-Person Court Appearance | 10 News
description: Tyler Robinson, 22, made his first in-person court appearance in Utah, where he faces aggravated murder and firearm charges over the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.  The hearing focused on transparency concerns after an earlier closed session, with media organisations seeking access to transcripts and Kirk’s widow urging for full public openness.  Prosecutors outlined evidence including DNA on a bolt-action rifle recovered near the scene and text messages in which Robinson appeared to confess and cite political motives.  Robinson, who surrendered a day after the shooting, has not entered a plea.  Prosecutors say they will pursue the death penalty. title: What Do Social Media Algorithms Push To Teenagers’ TikTok Accounts? | 10 News+
description: To test what types of content social media platforms were pushing to teenagers, before the ban maybe kicked in on December 10, 10 News+ set up two fake accounts on TikTok – one male, one female, both 14 years old. The fake girl’s account was flooded with make-up tips, dancing videos and instructions on extreme dieting. The fake boy’s account was very different – filled with pranks, sexualised content, and schoolyard brawls.  This package aired on December 10. title: White House Confirms Plan To Seize Oil From Venezuela Vessel | 10 News
description: The White House has confirmed the United States intends to seize the oil onboard a tanker off the coast of Venezuela with links to the nation.  The vessel, carrying 1.1 million barrels of oil, is, according to the United States, a part of an illicit oil shipping network.  Following the seizure, Venezuela President Nicolas Maduro has pushed back at his US counterpart Donald Trump's administration, demanding the end of "the United States government's illegal and brutal interventionism". title: Stadium Burned Down After Relegation | 10 Sport
description: Following their relegation from Finland's first division, FC Haka fans set fire to the club's stadium.  Three minors have been accused of the fire that destroyed the stadium, with one of them confessing to starting the blaze.  All of the three minors are under the age of 15, with Finnish law exempting anyone under that age from criminal prosecution. title: Six Injured As Suspected Gas Blast Destroys Three Properties In California | 10 News
description: A doorbell camera captured the moment a massive explosion destroyed three properties in Hayward, California, injuring at least six people.  Firefighters were called just before 9:40am and arrived to find two homes and a workshop reduced to rubble.  Authorities say the blast appears to have been caused by a damaged underground gas line, though investigations are ongoing.  All six victims were taken to hospital as crews continue to the debris for anyone else unaccounted for. title: Teens' Reaction To Social Media Ban, Ultra-Processed Baby Snacks, Rules For E-Bikes | 10 News+
description: This 10 News+ bulletin aired on December 10.  To test out what types of content social media platforms are pushing to teenagers, before today’s social media ban kicked in, 10 News+ set up two fake accounts on TikTok - one male, one female, both 14 years old. The fake girl’s account was flooded with make-up tips, dancing videos and instructions on extreme dieting. The fake boy’s account was very different - filled with pranks, sexualised content, and schoolyard brawls.  Network Political Editor Ashleigh Raper sat down with Julie Inman Grant, Australia’s eSafety Commissioner, who opened up about the journey to getting the nationwide under-16s social media ban into effect. Grant admits there will be “teething issues” with the ban’s rollout, and says parents are able to report any incidents of social media platforms not complying with the ban.  10 News+ sat down with teenage girls from St Joseph’s Catholic College on the New South Wales Central Coast who have been saving photos and memories from their favourite apps in preparation for the social media ban for under-16s. Tilly, Coco, Helen and Imogen are aged 14 and 15 years old and label the harmful content spreading online as ‘demoralising’, ‘toxic’, ‘influential’ and ‘unsafe’. They all agree there is a problem, but have differing views on the ban and question if it will work.  Chloe Mowday, an Australian mother of three, has been left in a coma and on life support after travelling overseas for a cosmetic procedure. Mowday went to Vietnam for rhinoplasty, commonly referred to as a ‘nose job’, and some surgery on her eyelids. The day after her procedure, she went downhill and had to be put in an induced coma in hospital, with her organs starting to shut down. title: Trump’s New Invasive Rules Proposed For Tourists Travelling To The US | 10 News
description: If you were thinking of heading to next year's football World Cup or perhaps a family holiday to Disneyland, be prepared for your travel plans to become a whole lot more complicated and invasive.   The Trump administration is proposing new rules for tourists from 42 countries - including Australia - which would see travellers forced to share their DNA and their entire social media history, for the past 5 years.   Samantha Butler with this 10 News plus report.
